titleStmt.author: Garthwait, Henry

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: A Friend at a stand, at his Friends worke.
analytic.author: Garthwait, Henry

monogr.title: Mischeefes mysterie: or, Treasons master-peece, the Powder-plot : Inuented by hellish malice, preuented by heauenly mercy: truely related. And from the Latine of the learned and reuerend Doctour Herring translated, and very much dilated. By Iohn Vicars
monogr.author: Herring, Francis

div.head: A Friend at a stand, at his Friends worke.

lg.l: VVHo reades this worke, areade my wonder; tell
What skill to verse a Fact so ill, so well.

l.hi: Vnresolued of nothing in your Loue but this.

lg.head: Alias The Placet of his Friends Essay.
lg.l: OThers thy zeale and vowes, I praise thy skill
So well to lay the Plott, Rome layde so ill.

lg.head: Another. Arts Pyramides, from Treasons Pouder-Fire.
lg.l: WHat all fire hath, hath thine, blacke smoke, bright flame,
The flame thy Verse: the smoke the Traitors name:
Who can, decide; in which most time to spend
Or damne their smoke, or thy bright flame commend.

closer.signed: Himselfe not yet determined, THO: SALISBVRY, Mr. in Arts Camb.
